#!/bin/python

import math

t = int(raw_input())
ct = 1
def isPerfect( n ) :
	p = math.sqrt( n )
	if( p % 1 == 0 ) :
		return True
	else :
		return False

while( ct <= t ) :
	n = int(raw_input())
	v = 5*n*n
	v2 = v + 4
	v3 = v - 4
	if( isPerfect( v2) or isPerfect( v3 ) ) :
		print 'Yes'
	else :
		print 'No'
	ct += 1
